alert.note: Alert for Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 03 at 9:34AM EST until March 04 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio, northeast Ohio and northwest Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Ashland, Crawford, Huron, Knox, Marion, Morrow and Richland. In northeast Ohio, Holmes. In northwest Ohio, Hancock, Sandusky, Seneca, Wood and Wyandot. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong storm system will deliver widespread rainfall of 1 to 1.5 inches to the area. Localized greater amounts are possible in northwest Ohio. This heavy rainfall and wet antecedent soils may lead to river rises and flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
